results.title: In the swim
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Young British swimmers and divers demonstrate their prowess. Champions seen in action include Margaret Edwards and Margaret Austen, Ian Black and Brian Phelps. Describes the important points of style and movement which they use in different types of swimming strokes and high dives.

results.title: In the South seas: palm and steeple
results.creator_credit: Gordon Babineau and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Interviews with foreign residents of the Solomon Islands provide a history of the involvement of plantation owners and Christian missions in the area. Contains very early footage of local customs. Narrated by George Woodcock.

results.title: Le Caillou
results.brief_description: A documentary about New Caledonia, which shows the nickel plant, and the inroads mining has made on the environment. Traditional forms of agriculture are shown, as well as the traditions of village life. These continue despite the French presence in the territory and the effects of nearly a century of resource exploitation on New Caledonia’s environment. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: In the South Seas
results.creator_credit: James Fitzpatrick and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film is the record of an Australian scientific expedition to five remote villages in Papua, New Guinea and the Trobriand Islands, 150 miles off the East Coast of New Guinea. The expedition consisted of an agriculturalist, two nutritionists, a bio-chemist, a bacteriologist, an anthropologist, a dentist, a cinematographer, and a doctor. The aim of the expedition was to study the diet of the local people, how their food-stuffs are grown, what nutritional deficiencies they suffer from, what diseases - attributable to their diet or otherwise - they suffer from, and how their customs arising from the social structure of the tribe or village, controls or affects agriculture and hunting, and thus their diet and their health. Commentary by Wilfred Thomas.

results.title: In the service of peace
results.brief_description: Considers the work of the United Naitons in preserving peace throughout the world. Looks at various trouble-spots where UN forces are involved, particularly Cyprus. Here troops are maintaining surface peace and quiet between the Greeks and Turks. Highlights the training and activities of the Swedish contingent.

results.title: In the service of Europe
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the importance of the Economic Council of Europe to every citizen of the 30 countries involved. It has stimulated and organised trade and promoted co-operation, through discussion, the interchange of ideas and assistance among the interdependent nations.

results.title: In the name of religion
results.creator_credit: James J. Cullen, J William Walker and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Minorities”.
Although religious freedom is guaranteed by the U.S. Constitution, prejudice against minority religious groups is a strong feature of American society. This film traces history of immigration and the growth of intolerance and persecution of religious minorities.

results.title: In the movies it doesn't hurt
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Barry Palin and Illustra Films
results.brief_description: Made in a style similar to the “Carry on” movies, this very funny film shows what should and shouldn’t be done in a school laboratory. Sid James features in a film clip and cast also includes Bernard Bresslaw and John Merrigan. NB: Some equipment shown is not used in Australian schools. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: In the form of clay
results.creator_credit: Olle Hallberg, Stig Lasseby, Tor Flyckt and Gustavsbergs Fabriker
results.brief_description: The procelain industry of Gustavsberg in Sweden is shown in all its aspects from the processing of the raw clay to the finished product; moulding and forming, the application of color and design by hand and machine followed by the glazing and firing. Features the designs of three of Sweden’s foremost craftsmen.

results.title: In the dark
results.creator_credit: David Eady, Ronald H. Riley and Ronald H Riley and Associates
results.brief_description: Shows what can be done to prevent a variety of accidents. Analyses one industrial accident and shows how easily the complacency of management, the foolishness of workers, domestic and social pressures can create danger - at work and at home - and can lead to years of heartbreak and hardship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Eady, Ronald H. Riley and Ronald H Riley and Associates
